choices: A member of Kevin and Kell Declaw's family
a active member of Rabbit's Revenge
a active member of Herd Thinners
a human trapped in the K&K world
1.content: Welcome to the world of K&K!!!!! First of all, who are you?
1.title: Welcome to the world of K&K!!!!!

11.content:
Here is a brief description of all the family members.

Kevin: He's the alpha male of the family, even though he's a rabbit. Being extremely buff and being relatively unafraid of predators, he finally met Kell on a predators chat group. He is second in command of company Hare Links.

Kell: She is a fit wolf and well respected business woman at Herd Thinners. Herd Thinners is a company that tries to keep other species from over populating by eating them.

Rudy: Kell's rebelious wolf son. His best friend is a wolf named Bruno, and his girlfriend is a fox named Fiona Fennec. Sometimes he's got a problem with Kevin

Lindesfarne: A teenage hedgehog adopted by Kevin. She and her bat boyfriend are insectivores. Though she loves to eat bugs, her best friend Tammy is a moth. After almost eating her, they bonded.

So...... Who are ya?
11.title: Meet the family

112.content: "Oh what a day!" You can't help but complain to yourself. After spending all day you didn't catch anyone! Not a single person for lunch, not even a squirrel. You pat your growling stomach with one hand while keeping the other on the wheel. Maybe the herds started migrating early? Who knows, all you know is that your driving home with an empty stomach. Hmmmmmm......... Maybe you should swing by a fast food joint?
112.title: Heading home hungry

choices: Your husband, a giant rabbit named Kevin, comes in
Someone else walks into the kitchen
1121.content: Once you get home, you find that the situation doesn’t get any better. There is no meat in the fridge, your stomach complains loudly as you wonder what you should do for dinner, because of your daughter, Coney, there is no small game. You go over to the pantry, but only find things like condiments and herbivore foods, you close the pantry and wonder what you should do for dinner.
1121.title: Probibly Should Have Gone Shopping

1122.content:
You decide to swing into McPrey's drive threw. You just want something small. You pull up to the giant menu and look at all the animals you can pick from. Chicken Mcnuggets, kitty burgers, squirrel baked pie. "One raccoon raw please"

"Anything else maam" the bird on the other end squawks into the mike

"Nope hon, that’s it."

"$10.99 pull up to the first window."

You just shake your head sighing. Prices just keep going up and up. Ah the good old days when you could get 5 raccoons for a dollar. Instead of sitting there and reminiscing you pull up to the first window and pay. Driving up to the second window you grab the squirming bag out of the teenage alligator’s hand.

"Have a nice day maam." He mutters to you.

You’re not even listening. While driving you tear the terrified raccoon out of the bag. He's very tiny, hardly a mouthful. Still, prey species are supposed to be smaller than preds. Big eats little, that’s the way it’s always been.

"Please don't eat me Miss Wolf, I'll do anything."

You toss him in the air and catch him in your snapping jaws. Your tongue covers his writhing form in saliva.

"Hmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm delishioush." You mutter, your words muffled by the Raccoon in your mouth. He tries to stick his paws out of your lips so you just suck them back in again.

"sthay in dere." You growl

He cowers and curls up into a ball on your tongue. You can hear him crying in your mouth. You sigh and swallow him down. You’re not a bad person but hey, you gotta eat. Well it’s probably time to head home.
1122.title: You had your snack, now what?

12.content:
Here is a brief description of Kevin and Kells friends.

Fiona Fennec: A teenage fox girl dating Rudy. Though she is really a good person at heart, she loves to eat people.

Candice: Candice is a dog who works for Hare Link. She's close friends with Kevin yet still predatory. She would never eat a client though, she's very loyal.

One of the Ursals: A bear family that lives nearby.

Bruno: a wolf, and Rudy's best friend. He is dating a sheep named Corrie.

Rhonda: An overweight tigress who likes to eat way too much.

So who are YOU??!!!!
12.title: Close Pals

15.content: It is very rare for a human to show up in the K&K universe but not unkown. Recently portals linking the two worlds have been opening up. The birds, who have known about the humans for years, are trying to keep it under wraps. As of late though, the truth has come closer and closer to being exposed. YOU are one of the humans who have crossed over. Will you find a worm hole and travel back to your own realm. Will you embrace the K&K world? Will you even SURVIVE? Only time will tell.
15.title: A human in a different realm

choices: no, your some sort of animal
151.content: WHOOPS, it seems that traveling through these worm holes can cause a change in your genetic make up. Are you still a human?
151.title: Changes

1511.content: Luckily your the same. Still, in a world filled with preds and prey, that could prove to be a problem. You've got nothing to protect you. No antlers, no fur, no claws, no nothing. You are amazingly edible. Simply because a pred has never seen a human before, doesn't mean they're not willing to try new things. Even more bad news. The worm hole you fell through hasn't dropped you off in the safest of havens. Though you found your portal inside your bathroom, its led you to a very frightening place. Your in
1511.title: Worm Holes = Doom

1512.content: It seems that your no longer the person you once were.
1512.title: AN ANIMAL????!!!!!

15121.content: Even worse your prey!!!! To be precise, you've changed into a
15121.title: Your now prey for the masses!

151212.content: Though you don't yet know it, your fate has practically already been sealed. It seems you've shown up in
151212.title: not that lucky.......

choices: go into the bedroom on your right (Rudy's room)
Go downstairs into the kitchen (with Kevin and Kell)
1512121.content: You can't help but tremble. It would seem that you've shrunk and that your now covered in fur. Very slowly you reach behind your back only to feel a long bushy tail. "Oh my god whats happened to me?!!!!" You pause hearing the sound of your own voice. "Wait a minute, I still sound like me." Looking yourself over you discover your still wearing your clothes but they've been modified to fit your new form. Looking around you it would seem that your inside a hollowed out tree designed just like a house. If this is just one tree it must be pretty thick! Just then you hear muffled voices below you "Tha- wh-n I told hi- to just dr-p it." "Ye-h whats h-s pro-lem?" you hear voices echoing below you. Maybe you could get help? Slowly you step out into the hall. You hear loud music coming from the room to your right. "Maybe I should go in there?" But what if the residents aren't friendly? What if they feel you've broken into there home? There could be serious trouble! Best to try to sneak up on them and see what kind of people your dealing with.
1512121.title: Meeting the Dewclaws

choices: "We need to meet the others outside."
15121211.content: You start to creep towards the door. Opening it slowly, you stick your head in and get barraged by deafening heavy metal. Looking around the room you can see it’s covered in posters of punk rockers. Besides the posters, the room is pretty plain. There’s a window and a computer to your left and a bed dead in front of you. Lying on the bed you see a teenage wolf in shades reading a magazine. Curious, you stick your head in a little further. Wow, he seems just like a human in every aspect...... Besides the fact that he happens to be a wolf. Suddenly he looks directly at you. "Oh man!" you whimper, "This isn't good." "A squirrel? What are you doing here?" he asks. "Did mom send you up here? It’s about time, get over here!" Nervous, you slowly start to walk towards him. When you finally get next to him he says
15121211.title: Rudy, are you his lunch or his pal?

151212111.content: now you know he wants to eat you. What do you do?
151212111.title: what now

choices: you look for a way out
1512121111.content:
You relize there is no point in trying to run. He will catch you anyway. He can obviusly out run you.

You start to walk to him as he gets of the bed. you have only taken a few steps and he is alredy towering over you. His masive body makeing a shadow the covers your whole body. He reaches down and picks you up by the back of your neck. He rases you over his head and opens his maw. You look down and you can see his huge pink mouth fade into black down his throught. Sudenly you are let go. You close your eyes as he catchs you in his maw. You feal his hot tung role over your furry body. Sudenly you feal a force pull you down into his throught. Then into his stumic.
1512121111.title: down the hatch

choices: He claims your there to help out, so you head for the fair
151212112.content: "Ummmm, sure whatever." You still don't know whats going on but its probably best not to argue. "By the way my names Rudy." with that he hopped off his bed and walked out of his bedroom, obviously exspecting you to follow him. Walking a pace or two behind him he starts to talk to you. "I'm surprised the Dakewood Volunteer Center sent you over to help out. I would have figured they would have sent a pred. Can't really say the place were headed for is safe for someone like you." Though he try to surpress it, you can't help but gulp. You could always tell him the center didn't send you, but then what? He would swallow you down in a hot second. Its probably better to just play along for now. You follow the young wolf down the stairs to the kitchen and out the side door. Standing outside is the weirdest group of teenagers you ever layed eyes on. Rudy starts to name them for you as you get closer. First he points to a strongly built wolf wearing a blue jacket and fleece draped over his shoulders, "Thats Bruno, he's my best friend." Next he pointed to the sheep beside him. "Thats Corrie, his girlfriend...." You can tell from the disgust in his voice that he doesn't approve. He then points to the last member of the group, a fox girl with pigtails and glasses, "This is my girl Fiona." As you guys draw closer Fiona steps forward. She gives Rudy a soft smile and then turns to smile at you, though this time its much more sinister. "Well Rudy its about time, we've been waiting forever. We were supposed to catch a bite to eat BEFORE heading to the county carnival. Now I know you didn't just make us wait for nothing. You wouldn't just let us stand outside on your lawn for 40 minutes unless you had something important to do." Rudy has started to look very uncomfortable. "Well uhhhh..... yeah, I had very important stuff to do." Fiona's face contorted in rage, "You liar I heard your stereo. You could hear that head banger garbage from a mile away. The only reason we didn't rush in is because your mom assured us you were finishing up your history project!" If Rudy could blush under all that fur, he certainly was doing so now. "I'm sorry it just slipped my mind." Bruno just laughed while Corrie shook her head. "Alright," Fiona snapped, "Lets just go..... who is this guy?" Rudy turns his attention back to you, "Oh, this is....uhhhhh.." Fiona's face suddenly lit up, "Oh you brought him along as a snack! Good, I'm starving, give him to me." You expect Rudy to deny it immediately and tell them about how your there to help out. Unfortunately Rudy doesn't respond. You look up to see that he is concentrating hard. "Rudy, tell her." Your starting to grow nervouse. You came here to help out!!!...... Or at least thats what he thinks. He wouldn't sacrifice you to appease his angry girlfriend would he? I mean, even preds have morals right? All of a sudden you start to tremble.
151212112.title: Will playing along work?

choices: try to talk your way out of it
1512121121.content:
"Uhh, yea sure." rudy says. Then he pickes you up and hands you to her. You qwiver with fear. You dont want to die like this.


She takes you in hear paws and starts to bringe you closer to her mouth. You try to talk but you cant. Yout life starts to flash befor your eyes.

You are right infront of her mouth now. She opens up her maw and holds you right over it. What do you do?
1512121121.title: your life is nothing when it comes to love

choices: Nope, a tastey snack you are!
Scream for Rudy's help! Maybe he can!
15121211212.content:
The sight of Fiona's huge muzzle, along with the view of her muzzle, with all its sharp and white teeth just make the words you were trying to say fall from your chest.

You look around, trying desperately for eye contact with some one who doesn't seem to be enjoying this sight of you above Fiona's jowls, but all you can see is the others drooling, you think that they probably wish they could have you instead, even Rudy looks like he wants to have you for a snack.

Your gaze moves back down to Fiona's jaws, her tongue has moved out of her muzzle and suddenly whacks you in the face, her hot drool just sticks wetly to you, even getting in your mouth as you try to scream. She doesn't seem to about the fact that you cant breath, she just gives a smile and lets go of you. You try to hold your arms out for something, even a tooth if it will help you, but nothing seems to be within grasp as you land with a wet smack against her tongue.

This time you seem to be able to do more then gasp, your scream barely seems to make it past your lips before the fox girl's muzzle slams shut around you, her tongue mashing you suddenly and forcefully against the ridged roof of her muzzle. Her hot saliva drenching your body as you gag on the thick drool, the smell of her muzzle making your head spin as she lets you back down suddenly, the stale air rushing into your lunges before you smack down again onto her tongue.

Fiona's muzzle opens and your suddenly bathed in white light as it filters in between the massive pearly whites of her teeth, strangely you think to yourself, "Man, she must be a good brusher...those are great looking."

She seems to be thinking about what to do...what does she decide?
15121211212.title: Mmm...Foxxie Chow!

1512121122.content:
"No, he's with us. The Dakewood Volunteer Center sent him to help us out at the carnival." Fiona seemed a little disappointed but she didn't argue. You can't help but breathe a sigh of relief. "Alright," Fiona growls in frustration, "Lets just get this over with."

When you finally arrive at the fair you can plainly see why Rudy thought it might me dangerous for you. Everyone there is a predator! "Ummmm, Rudy I'm starting to have second thoughts. Rudy looked down at you and smiled barring his teeth. "Don't worry about it, no one is going to chow down on your when your with me!" "That’s really not all that reassuring......" Finally you reach your stand and split from your group. Behind the counter there are tons of stuffed animals and....... Meat products? About 20 feet from the counter are 3 sets of 6 bottles. Rudy hops over the counter and you follow, climbing on top of it considering your much shorter in stature. "Okay," Rudy explains, "Were in charge of a fairly simple game. Its $3.00 for 3 balls, the player has to knock down all 6 of these bottles to win. The money raised will go to children's hospital." "Oh well" you sigh, "At least it’s for a good cause..."

For the next couple hours you help run the stand. You had some pretty close calls too. One bear blew $18 bucks trying to win a stuffed gator. He was so angry for a moment you thought he was going to attack the stand. Another time a lioness asked if she could have you for a prize instead of packaged meat. Rudy played along at first, but then he relented and told her to back off. Suddenly Rudy hopped over the counter, "Okay were done for now!" "Good" you exclaim, "I was starting to think that this would never end." "30 minute break," Rudy yelled as he started to run into the crowd, "Be back here by then!" "HEY WAIT!!!!!!!!!! YOU CAN'T JUST LEAVE ME HERE!!!" To late.... He's disappeared into the crowd. Oh well that’s just great, now what are you going to do? You’re a sitting duck without him.
1512121122.title: your stand at the carnival

15121211221.content:
You decide to stay at the stand. Maybe if you stay hidden behind the counter nobody will notice?Unfortunately you soon find out that the answer to your question is no. Catching your scent 3 cats peer over the counter, leering down at you.

They appear to be teenage mountain lions, about your age. There are 3 of them, two female one male. "I want to play!" The boy mountain lion says, staring at you with hungry eyes. The two lionesses behind him giggle. Slowly he pulls $3.00 out of his pocket and extends his paw. Is he for real, or is this some sort of trick? If you try to take the money he might snatch you but if you run.........
15121211221.title: Trustworthy?

15121211222.content: Might as well check the place out. If someone wanted to eat you, they'd eat you. Theres really nothing you can do about that. Crawling over the counter you scurry past the large crowds and to a huge posted map of the park. "Well now, were do I want to go...." Occourding to the map, to the south is a haunted house, a few rough rides, and a fun house filled with mirrors and pranks. To the north there are more events than rides. Occourding to the posted times on the side of the map, alot of shows should be starting right now. The map is very vague, and describes them as being 'hands on' type events. "Hmmmmmmmmmm....."
15121211222.title: live a little

choices: have them see you, the foxgirl Fiona licks her lips
15121212.content: You decide to head down the stairs. Your taking things slowly, after the transformation you just underwent anything could happen. After making it down the stairs you hear voices from the kitchen. Heading inside you see a wolf woman and a fox girl talking. You decide to slowly back up only to
15121212.title: To the kitchen

choices: cute you are, she is still hungry
she finds you simply adorible. she cant do it
151212121.content: You walk into the room, and call out"hey, could you help me?" fiona looks down at you. She licks her lips. You see her do this and get very nervis. then she grabs you and brings you right infront of her mouth. You relize whats about to happen and start to think aobut all the people in your wourld you are going to leave. you sats to wimper then cry. The fox girl looks at your face and sees that your crying. she looks at you kind of sad. what hppens next?
151212121.title: fox girl looks hungry

15122.content: Great! You're a carnivore! (Still an animal but it's better than the possibility of being lunch!) Looking at your 'new' self, you find that you're a-
15122.title: Well at least there's SOME good news!

choices: It's Coney Dewclaw,  the baby girl.
153.content: You find yourself in this new world of predator and prey. Fortunaty, you've stayed your true shape, that of a human adult male. Unfortunatly for you, as you look around, you find there has been one major alteration...you've shrunk! Why, you couldnt be more than an inch tall. As if that wasnt bad enough, you seem to be in some one's home. You hear someone approaching....
153.title: New Perspectives

choices: Giant bird people. Been there done that. Now untie me!
155.content:
"Listen I said I was sorry, alright!" you yell at the odd shapes outside the shaft of light which is pinning you to a chair, with a little help from a few straps across your abdomen, knees, and elbows.

"Well sorry isn't going to cut it. Do you know how illegal it is for you to be here, on this world?" asked the voice of an older woman, who's shadowy form moved in and out of focus to your eyes as she seemed to sway from side to side.

"Not really no. I mean I wasn't intending on coming here in the first place," you complain to the figure as it moves around you.

"Then why did you end up here?" it demands.

"Because somebody created a Heisenberg/Pournelle bridge and forgot that you have to clamp the far end down using a tetrion beacon, otherwise it will fluctuate around the local space looking for any source of tetrions, which happened to be present in a multidimensional interface terminal that I was using to...well it doesn't matter what I was using it for, and if you want me gone then just point me in the direction of the nearest off-world transport," you retort, hoping they don't question too closely what you were doing at such a terminal in the middle of your planet's night cycle.

You needn't have worried though, as most of the shapes, including the one that had been talking to you, begin to mumble on the other side of the room in the darkest corner. Their voices are accented oddly so you can't make out most of what they're saying, but the terms homosapien, the homeworld, and disaster of unparalleled proportions seem to crop up a lot, making you somewhat nervous. You really weren't here through any choice of your own, and you just want to get home, or at least to some place where you can live comfortably.

"Hey, I can hear some of what you're saying, so how about cluing me into the rest you, uhh. That reminds who exactly are you people?" you ask, realizing you've never seen one of your captors up close. You woke up tied to this chair after passing out due to interdimensional travel strains. Those strains might also explain the hominid forms that seem to walk just like... The lights snap on at that moment and you look at your captors for the first time....
155.title: Voices from the shadows

1552.content:
"Ok. So I'm not on my planet anymore. Can you please loosen these straps now, and then send me home?" you ask, trying to sound as sincere as possible, though you know that it isn't exactly working. As unsurprised as you are at their appearance, they seem to be very surprised about your's.

"Can you believe this? I thought humans were extinct!" comments one of the more colorful avians out of the side of his mou-er beak to one that you believe to be a raven. The raven nods and whipsers something back, but you can't quite make out what it is when a more dominating presence pulls you away from them, namely a presence belonging to a condor, or something like that.

"Who are you human, and more importantly where are you from?" she asks in a voice that commands your obedience and respect, a leader's voice.

"My name, feather head, is Corrin Markus, and I'm from the Outreach galaxy, sector Tango India Foxtrot, System name Garcon with a blue type L3 star, 7th planetary body out, named Exion," you tell her, trying to sound just as mean. Considering you're tied to a chair in a room of creatures that could probably kill you at a moment's notice, maybe not the best idea, but you feel like you need to establish some strength for yourself. The female, or so you assume from her voice, doesn't seemed shocked at all by your aggression, though some of the others recoil from you as you stare into her eyes in an ancient contest of wills. One which ends in a mutual draw as you back away from each other. How does the avian woman react?
1552.title: Butting heads with a big bird

15522.content:
"And my name is Ms. Aura, Mr. Markus, welcome to New Terra," she told him, waving her wing in an all too human gesture towards one of the windows, which showed that they were no orbiting high above a world that looked to be an exact duplicate of the pictures of Old Home Terra you remember from your ancient history books.

"There are so any reasons why I can't be looking at what I'm seeing right now, not the least of which is that Old Home Terra was destroyed when Sol went nova back in twenty-seven- fifty-three," you tell them as the straps holding you down are loosened by a few of your new associates. They have just finished explaining some of their history to you, from how they ‘acquired' human tech left on Old Terra and then came to this world, inserting human DNA into the biosphere using a time machine acquired on Earth, and since forbidden by human governments.

"As I've told you, Corrin, despite the similarities that is not Earth, at least not the one your people remember. We made it a bit different from that place by infusing human DNA into more natural species," explains Ms. Aura again as you begin to rub the raw parts of you wrists, which are red from you attempts upon first waking up to break your bonds. You are then handed you belt with weapon holster, and put it on immediately.

"So how long until I can be sent home?" you ask as you straighten your shirt, which seriously smells like it needs some cleaning after you were visiting certain sites on the Multidimensional Terminal before being sucked through a wormhole.

"Well I don't know. Some of the guys in the tech division were responsible for this mishap, and so they're working on how to fix it, but until they do you're going to be living with me so that I can keep an eye on you," says the avian woman, who is the only one to speak to you like a person since your arrival at this end of the universe. The others look at you with either revered awe or disgust, depending on what they know about humans.

"Wait a second, what do you mean living with you? Why can't I just stay here until the big brains with little sense figure out how to send me home?" you ask her as you follow her through the halls of the ship orbiting New Terra.

"Because, this ship was not designed to accommodate your kind, and it simply isn't a place where you can live," she tells you as you walk behind her.

"And New Terra is? You told me they eat each other down there!" you exclaim at her back. You are well aware that she says she's average height for her planet, and she's at least 16 centimeters taller than you if you include her wing tips.

"Yes they do, but you area human, and according to our records you conquered a planet full of species like that, using sticks and sharpened stones, and according to you you're much more developed now" she points out to you, and your hand shoots to the holster on your hip holding a standard issue dueling pistol, which could probably blow a hole in the ship if you wanted it to.

"So then I live with you until they can send me home?" you ask her as you arrive at your destination, a room with small circular pads on the floor with a raised console built in front of each one.

"If they can send you home. It may not be possible, and if it isn't then you have to learn to survive," she tells you as she punches a few buttons on one console and then motions for you to stand beside her, instantly you are caught up in a flash of light and are suddenly standing in a room that seems to come straight out of the history books of Old Terra. Everything from the TV to the couch looks like something found in an American home of the late twentieth and early twenty-first centuries.

"Mom, who's that?"asks a smaller version of you hostess who waddles up to her and then is picked up in why you remember your mother picking you up.

"He's a visitor from out of town son. Do you remember those history lessons I gave you about our people and global domination?" she asks the boy, quite calmly considering what it is she just said. The boy nods his head as his mother points to you.

"Well this man is a human. Something bad happened in orbit and he ended up here. They should have finished making him an identity by now, so why don't we see what you're listed as, shall we?" she asks, moving towards an old Personal Computer Terminal, something else that is straight out of the human past. A few keystrokes later you see her pull up a file with your name, age, weight, blood type, and disturbingly, your nutritional facts, along with a species of...
15522.title: Meeting Ms. Aura, and making a new life

choices: Calmly fall, knowing that if she'd wanted to kill you there were easier, cle
155221.content:
"I am not a lemur!" you proclaim to the avian woman as the file comes up to your species.

"You are now Markus, remember that. We can't go around calling you a human after all, as parts of the genetic codes on this world contain memories of Old Terra. If they discovered what a human was some might begin to access those memories, and well you know that human emotions are erratic and quite strong," she comments to you, logging off of her terminal which she then covers with a curtain, as if trying to hide it.

"And now I'm going to have to explain you to my landlord," she said in a very vexed tone as she looks you up and down, studying you like a side of beef. You interrupt her musings by putting you hand up and causing her to look at you like a person again.

"Why explain it at all? Just say I'm a friend from out of town who may be staying for a while considering how well a business deal goes thorough with the local big wigs," you suggest, and Ms. Aura walks around in a circle twice before nodding and facing you again.

"You know that's not half bad. How'd you come up with that?" she queries.

"Well if everything in this room is what I think it is, then your society is based off Old Terrans known as Americans. I've played one in games often enough to assimilate at least some of the culture," you explain to her as she begins rummaging through a nearby chest, finally emerging with a coil of rope.

"Good, then hopefully we can blend you in at the local school," she murmurs, tying the rope around your waist with her surprisingly strong wings/hands.

"What do you mean school?" you ask her as she finishes securing the line.

"Well while your suggestion is a good one we're going to alter it a bit. I'm going to say your parents are somewhere else in the world at the moment and that you are staying with me as a favor to their family," she tells you.

"What? Why?!" you demand, not really caring for where this conversation is going.

"Well because of your size my human friend. You are about the same height as most of the kids at the local school, and it will be much more convincing if you are a viewed as a child rather than as an adult," she says, pulling the loose of the rope around a hook in her wall.

"But I'm twenty years old!" you protest.

"Be that as it may, you look like fourteen on this planet, and so that's what you'll be," she says, guiding you towards the door of her apartment, and revealing the reason for your new fashion accessory, namely the long drop that is the first step out her door. Before you can make more than a minor protest the avian woman pushes you out the door and sends you hurtling to the ground below. You...
155221.title: Learning to fly... I mean fall

choices: A wolf boy about your height with sunglasses(Rudy)
A wolf woman and a rabbit man(Kevin and Kell)
1552212.content:
You let gravity take its course. And why not? You're a human being on a world ruled by shadowy avian overlords who claim they found the planet using Old Home technology. Dying right now would e somewhat preferable to life. At least the pounding your head would stop. Though you have to admit, you are a little curious. After all this was playing out like a Terminal Game, except with no reset switch to turn it off.

Your thoughts are suddenly jolted out of as the rope reaches its limit about half a meter off the ground, and you find yourself staring at the door to what looks like a tree house, literally. The design was something off the more natural worlds you've heard about, and not something that surprised a human like yourself, though you are surprised at the places size, which seems comparable to the Yggdrasil of Asgardius at the edge of the sector where your home is.

"Are you okay?" asks a familiar voice as Ms. Aura gently lands beside you.

"Considering everything that's happened to me in the past...I think forty-seven minutes, yeah I'm just peachy," you tell her sarcastically as you pull out you gun and prepare to shoot the rope.

"Stop!" she yells at you, putting her wing... hand... whatever over your pistol and then pulling slightly on the knot that has the rope tied to you, instantly causing it to come undone. She obviously expected you to fall flat on your face, but with reflexes honed through hours of Terminal games you land on your feet and bounce straight into a battle stance, dueling pistol at the ready.

"Impressive. I was given the impression that humans weren't quite that light on their feet," she comments to you.

"Well some of us aren't, but as a First Class duel winner I have few extra points in that regard," you tell her, spinning the pistol on you finger like some of the cowboys you've seen in old movies before returning it to its holster.

"Good, because I think you're going to need it," she tells you, walking up to the door of the house, whose mail box has the name Dewclaw on it. Not a good sign and you find your hand on the pistols butt as Ms. Aura knocks. After a few moments the door opens to reveal...

A wolf woman and a rabbit man(Kevin and Kell)
1552212.title: And here's the stars of our show

15522121.content:
"Hello Rudy, are your parents home," asks the condor woman who has become you guide to this strange world. Oddly you find the presence of a carrion eater to be comforting, as the boy, or rather wolf boy in shades looks her up and down before turning to you.

"Not right now, they went out to take Lindesfarne to a special class for her insect hunting. Coney went with them. So what's with the short, rat thing?" he asks pointing at you and snickering. You really want to hurt the wolf cub, but Ms. Aura's wing blocks you path.

"He's not a rat thing Rudy. His name is Corrin Markus and he happens to be a lemur," she corrects him. He looks at you again and then nods while looking up in to space in a thoughtful gesture.

"Oh right lemurs. You use them in a few of my mom's favorite dishes," he comments, smiling at you out of the corner of his mouth. Again you move to attack him, and again Ms. Aura blocks you.

"He's not an ingredient Rudy. He's a member of a friends family and he needs a place to stay for a while, until his parents get back. I need to ask your parents if it's okay with them," she tells him, and then looks back at you with a warning eye. Obviously she knows you could take the wolf boy, and doesn't want you hurting him. Too bad, the kid is asking for it.

"Well I don't see where mom would have a problem with that, and Kevin usually listens to her. So why don't you try back in an hour. I'll have the oven warmed up by then," he says, smiling at you again and showing off his fangs. You nearly let the rage take over and attack him, but instead do a three breathe exercise designed to calm an agitated mind.

"Good, well then I'll come back later," she tells him, waving goodbye even as she flutters off into the air, grabbing you by your shoulders and then hauling you up into her tree house. Landing proves to be a bit softer when you are dropped feet first and you are standing again eye to eye with the condor woman who is now your only possibility of getting home.

"Well that could have gone better," she tells you.

"You think?" you ask her sarcastically, moving to sit down in one of the odd chairs that you could have sworn weren't in the room before. Considering the avians' tech level you didn't doubt that they might be new to the room if not the planet, placed there for your comfort.

"Yes. I mean...
15522121.title: Rudy's rude

choices: tying the rope around your waist again
flying down to greet them, telling you to stay put
155221211.content:
You bolt up when she finishes her statement, not at all liking the tone. That wolf cub? Kill you? Laughable. You could have torn him to shreds a dozen ways from Sunday, all without breaking a sweat. You realize then just how little the bird woman values your skills at survival in this world. After all this is a world of eat or be eaten, jungle law, and whatever other synonyms for wild you can think of, and humans were not really that threatening a species to such things, at least not by looks alone.

"That wolf pup was nothing Aura. Let me go back down and I'll prove it to you," you exclaim, nearly running to the door before a wing stops you.

"Even if you could take him, which I doubt, I don't think beating up the child of the landlord is a good impression for you to make, hmm?" she tells you, forcing you to realize that she is right and you resume your seat. Beating on Rudy might be satisfying emotionally, but socially it was lacking in ept or grace.

"I guess you're right, but if what you told me is true then I have to establish myself as a predator or at least as a violent person before class tomorrow, otherwise I'm going to have to deal with them all day trying to take bites out of me," you respond to her.

"Don't worry about that. I'm a teacher of the class and I can keep most of the students off you, simply by lying and saying you're poisonous or something," she says, taking a perch that faces the chair in which you're sitting. You find anger welling up in you again, but do your best to contain it as you face the avian woman in the eyes.

"I will not hide behind shields like that. I am a Terminal Gamer, and we do not hide when fighting is more efficient. If you just give me a chance tomorrow I'll prove it to you," you tell her, and from there the conversation shifts to other matters, including subject material for tomorrow's class, and what you are going to wear, which is at least for now going to be what you have on. For almost an hour you continue to debate things with the woman when a honking horn announces the arrival of the family below. Ms. Aura looks out the door of her home and waves down at the odd looking group on the ground before...
155221211.title: Corrin Markus, Terminal Gamer

choices: the porcupine girl places her hand on your shoulder
1552212111.content:
The vulture woman reaches for the rope again, but this time you hold your hand over her's and shake your head.

"That won't be necessary," you tell her, taking the end of the rope from her hand and walking to the door. This time instead of being pushed you leap out of the door, letting the rope coil outward behind you, and causing you to halt a few feet off the ground before it rips out of your hand. Pulling your legs in you roll along the ground for a few seconds before leaping up and standing in a battle posture, this time leaving the pistol holstered at your belt.

Opening you eyes you find yourself face to tooth with the wolf woman who has leaped between you and her family, obviously intending on protecting them from you, but luckily before she can launch a preemptive strike Ms. Aura lands between the two and holds out her hands to stop you both.

"Corrin, impressive as that was, please don't do that again. It seems a lot like an aggressive move," she warns you, obviously startled by what you just did. The wolf woman, upon seeing your avian jailer/advisor/bodyguard stops in mid-pounce and un-ruffles her fur before walking up to the woman more calmly than you would have thought possible for someone just so recently agitated.

"Hello Ms. Aura, this young being wouldn't happen to be one of your's would it?" she asks.

"For the moment he is anyway, Kell. I was wondering if you would have any problem with him staying with me while his parents are away on business," she asks somewhat sheepishly, a new emotion for her in your eyes. She hadn't kowtowed to anyone else, but then this wolf woman was supposed to be her landlord, and that might explain a bit of the subservience. Feeling a need to show respect you bow to the woman you now know is named Kell.

"It is a pleasure to make your acquaintance," you tell her as you rise, realizing her height for the first time, and making you feel even more like a midget as she stands up straight from her own battle stance and then bows back to you.

"Likewise. And Aura, any friend of your's is a friend of ours, so long as he knows the rules of the house," she tells Aura, and you look at the bird woman with a raised eyebrow. She hadn't mentioned anything about house rules, though she had been a little busy telling you about the social rules of this strange planet you now find yourself on.

"Well I hadn't gotten around to telling him all of them, but I'm sure he can learn quick enough. Corrin, why don't you help them with those grocery bags while I discuss some things with Mrs. Dewclaw, hmm?" she says, almost sweetly. You contain your own distaste for the woman and wander over to where a very tall rabbit man is unloading brown bags from the car, handing them to what looks like a porcupine girl.

Getting the suggestion you walk over and pick up two of the bags yourself and follow the girl as she walks into the house. You notice as you follow her that she can't seem to take her eyes off you, and not in the same way as the wolf boy. Her attention is not on you as a food source, instead you can see an inquisitive sparkle in her eye as she looks up and down you body, making you feel even smaller compared to her. At last the two of you arrive in the kitchen, and you turn to go out and get more bags but are stopped as...
1552212111.title: Helping wth the groceries

15522121112.content:
Her touch is surprisingly gentle as she places her clawed hand upon your shoulder, forcing you to turn and face her, that same inquisitive look burning in her eyes.

"So what species are you Corrin?" she asks point blank. For a moment, just a moment you almost answer the question with your species name, just as you would with any customs official, but you catch yourself just in time.

"I'm a...Short Haired Lemur, and my name is Corrin Markus," you tell her, trying to act proud of the lie you are having to live down.

"A short hair lemur?" she says questioningly, looking you up and down and circling around you. Something tells you that she doesn't believe, and that she may just know what you are, although how she would is beyond you.

"Yes. We aren't really common, indigenous to only a few island chains," you say, hoping that this world is similar to Old Home Terra in the distribution of species, and that this porcupine girl has never actually met a lemur before.

"Oh, ok then. Well my name is Lindesfarne Dewclaw. Welcome to our side of the world," she tells you, still looking at you out of the corner of her eye, as if she knows that you are lying. Trying to shrug off the feeling you follow her back outside to find that Rudy and the big rabbit man already have the groceries well in hand and are taking them inside, with Mrs. Dewclaw and Ms. Aura trailing behind talking in low voices, though you hear your name and Rudy's both used at least once.

"Why do I have a bad feeling about this?" you mutter to yourself as you bring up the rear of the new formation going into the house of the Dewclaw's. Once inside the door closes behind you with a thud like the knelling of a death bell, nearly causing you to throw yourself against it and run, but you control that primal instinct. After all you've been in worse straights than this, and you will survive, if only so you can go back and finish that match the bird brains pulled you away from.

After setting the rest of the bags in the kitchen the entire family, plus you and Aura enter what you would call a sitting room, everyone else taking a personalized seat, leaving you standing with your foot against the wall near the exit. Most of the eyes in the room shift from you to Ms. Aura, obviously asking her for the explanation on your presence.

"Well then, now that we're settled I have some introductions to make," says the bird woman from a perch waving her hand around the room in an all encompassing gesture before bring her wing to solely point at you.

"Everyone this is Corrin Markus. His family has been a friend of mine for many generations, and a few hours ago his parents were forced to ask me if I would take care of him for a while," she says, already falling fast into the lie that her people fabricated for you, and pointing at each of the family members for you in turn, saying their names for you and causing you to nod at each. Kevin is the name of the rabbit, and he is the father of the family, with Kell, the wolf woman, as his lovely wife. Rudy and Lindesfarne both nod in response to your nods at them, and Rudy smiles that infuriating smile of his. The last memeber of the family is apparently a baby rabbit named Coney, though you know the eyes of a predator when you see one.

"Corrin this is everyone. Now that that's over Corrin will be attending the local school tomorrow in...
15522121112.title: Lindesfarne's Suspicious

choices: the shine of the sun through a window.
155221211121.content:
"What?!" Rudy exclaims, obviously not to happy about what he's hearing. You knew from hat Aura told you earlier that her people were the teachers on this planet. Most of them anyway, and so any class you go to will be at least somewhat protected, but obviously Ms. Aura is still intent on keeping her personal eyes on you. Not that it matters to you. One jailer is the same as any other as far as you're concerned.

"Yes, Rudy. Corrin will be attending your class, and I hope you help him to try and fit in. He's new to this area and Ms. Aura says he's probably not going to be too good at fitting in right at first. You will help him, right?" asks Kell in a voice that you can't help but admire. A voice and tone that remind you so much of Jasmine. Rudy, with a very reluctant grunt, agrees, or at least you think that growling sound means he agrees as Kell and Kevin both smile at him.

"Good then. So Corrin, where exactly are you from?" asks Kell innocently, not noticing the spark in her daughter's eyes that makes you feel like walking out of the room, but you can't run away, not from a simple question, so you answer with the information you can remember about lemurs on Old Home Terra.

"From the south seas, Mrs. Dewclaw. A small island chain with very little resources, but a beautiful ocean view, and trees more beautiful and colorful than anything you could believe," you tell her, trying to sound homesick. Taking a sidelong glance at Ms. Aura you find that she's nodding in approval. Obviously this planet is a lot like Old Terra, more so than you thought would be possible.

"Sounds nice. So why did your parents leave?" she asks, just as innocently, though this time Aura's eyes also go a bit wide, knowing that you haven't been told that part of your cover story. You decide that in this case ignorance my be the best defense.

"I don't really know myself. My parents don't think I'm ready to get too involved in the business adults yet, so they just told me it was important for them to leave and that Ms. Aura could take care of me until their business was concluded and they could swing by and take me back home," you tell them, trying your best to act like one of those teenagers from the old holo films about American society of the twentieth century, namely uninterested and uncaring.

"Oh? I would think you'd have someone closer than that who was able to take care of you," commented Mrs. Dewclaw as she looked at you, luckily this time it is Ms. Aura's turn to fill in the gaps in the story.

"Well there is, but since his parents are going to be over here they want to be able to at least visit their son, so he's staying with me so that they can at least be on the same side of the planet as each other," says the bird lady, more pointedly than she probably should have, but none of those around seem to notice as they nod in agreement. Family values must be a bit higher in this society than in the ones of the old Americans. The family, well Kell and Ms. Aura anyway, spend the next few hours droning on about things which don't matter to you at all, and you can see a look of utter boredom in Rudy's eyes that you know is mirrored in your own.

Maybe you are too different after all. At last though the conversation of the two women runs to a close, and they say good night while Ms. Aura leads you towards the door of the Dewclaw home. Once outside she prepares to take you up in her claws again but you stop her, grabbing onto the rope and pulling yourself up to her home. Though it does take a bit longer than flying would have, climbing gives you the physical exertion you need to clear your mind, and face the two bird people, Ms. Aura and her son, with a cal and centered mind once you get up to their tree house and then coil up the rope before hanging it on a hook.

"So, how did you like the Dewclaws?" asks Ms. Aura the minute you finish putting away the rope.

"Interesting specimens of this planet. Worthy of further observation," you tell her, trying to reestablish with her that despite the grade she's putting you in, you are an adult, with knowledge about the universe she can only dream of.

"I would hope so. They are the best hope for future peace this planet has after all," she responds as she picks up her son and flies to one of the lofts set into the wall of the house. You look after her with a questioning eye, but you see that both she and her kid are trying to get comfortable and get to sleep after what has probably been for them an interesting day. After all you're the first human they've met. Ever.

A fact that isn't lost on you when you find that the only place for you to sleep is in the chair you had been siting in during Ms. Aura's lecture on the planet's culture and customs. Not feeling like complaining at the moment you climb into the extremely plush chair and quickly drift off to sleep. It wasn't the first time you'd had to make due with something that was not a real bed, and in fact this was one of the better chairs you'd encountered, making it easy to fall asleep. You awaken the next morning to...
155221211121.title: Cover story, making it up as you go along

choices: pull a flute from the opposite side of your belt from your holster.
1552212111211.content:
"Get back, Bradley!" you shout at the kid as he lunges forward, holding his war pike out in front of him as he does. The pike, it's tip shining with energy, slices into the flesh of the monstrous behemoth that is facing you, and causes it to turn its gaze towards the kid.

"I can do this, sir!" he yells over the creature's angry roar, those glowing red eyes illuminating the rookie like a kid of living spot light, and showing off just how good he is with the pike. He drives it home again even as the creature turns towards him, causing it to leap away. Bradley seems to have the upper hand for a moment, before the whole scene shifts in whirl of chaos. Now instead of Bradley holding a war pike, all he has is a conical shape of rock that he's using to push the creature's attacks aside, but with every swipe of the creature's massive claws Bradley is pushed farther back, towards a wall.

"Look out, Kid!" you warn him, somehow your foot has now become wedge in part of the rock of the cavern, and you are unable to help Bradley beyond tossing a few rocks at the creature, a Hy'Tan Dragon, which ignores you for now, not seeing a trapped human as much of a threat. The focus of the monster's attention is Bradley, and it will not stop until the kid is dead. The twelve claw tipped tails lash out behind the thing in expectation, awaiting the moment when the prey is pinned and they can go in for the kill.

They forced to wait only a few seconds, as Bradley suddenly slips, slamming into the wall and knocking his makeshift weapon out of his torn and battered hands. With no way to defend himself he shouts at the creature with all his might, trying to scare it probably, but the Dragon knows no fear, and its tails spring forward simultaneously burying twelve different three-foot hooks through the boy's chest, causing his back to arch as the life leaves his body. Through with that prey the Dragon whips the tails and flings Bradley's limp body against a wall, causing a loud cracking of bones to permeate the cavern, which is soon replaced by the dull booms of the Dragon's feet as it approaches you, mouth open. From deep within a green light begins to build, and you can feel the heat coming from the open maw for only a second before the fire streams forth right at you in a river of death from which you cannot escape.

"No!" you cry as you wake up, dropping to the hardwood floor of the odd house in which you find yourself. Used to falling out of bed thanks to the old model anitgrav mattress you sleep on you are not hurt, yet you are stunned by your surroundings for a long moment, focusing you mind, and pushing the memories of the dream aside as you search for those of how you came to be here. Finding them tucked away in the back of your head you take a moment to review your situation and find that it is not one you enjoy, but it's better than the cave of a Hy'Tan Dragon.

Looking about you find that your avian hostess and her child are still asleep. Your cry was obviously not that loud. A second look around reveals no sink or bathroom that you can recognize, and it wasn't something you'd questioned the good bird about the other day. Feeling the need to use both you look out of a window that faces the chair where you'd been sleeping. The morning sun is just breaking over the horizon, and is probably the external stimuli that made the dragon's fire seem so real in the dream. Laughing at your own foolishness you look out upon the world that you are stranded on.

Your view is what one would call scenic, if nothing else. Everywhere you can see natural formation of land and earth, though some have power, phone, and other various lines running to them, giving an odd look to the entire area. Not one to focus on beauty very long you instead look for a stream or river, and luckily find one only a few dozen meters away from the house. Looking back at your hostess one last time you grab the rope from where it's curled around a hook in a wall, and then you open the door as quietly as you can. With not a single stir coming from the two birds you leap out the door and slide down the rope to the ground below.

Once on the ground you take a moment to look around, fanning out with your senses for any hint of danger. Not that this planet would be that dangerous to you. After all a Terminal Gamer of your level is supposed to be able to take down any foe one on one, and while these people may have been excellent hunters, such creatures rarely made good fighters. The depended on the prey to run and hide rather than stand and fight, and that is what a TG is trained to do if they can win the fight at least. Finding nothing too bad in the local area you make your way down the path to the stream.

Upon reaching the shores of the stream you are surprised to find it clean and pure. Truly pure, not like the waterways of other worlds you've seen, where the flow of waters like this are filtered at some point, pulling out everything that could prove harmful to populations downstream. This one though is pure in that its waters are untouched, and allowed to flow at least somewhat freely. Looking down you put you hand in and find the temperature nice and cool.

Good for swimming, though before the fun you have to do what you came to do. Pulling at your belt you remove the dueling pistol, and as expected you can feel the hollowness inside the sounding chamber, meaning it is empty. Sighing you thrust the smooth, chrome colored weapon directly into the water, and watch as suddenly whirlpools begin to form as the pistol's starts the process of taking in the water around it, and converting it into fuel for the gun's abilities. Since the process will take several minutes you lay back and...
1552212111211.title: Morning on a strange world

15522121112111.content:
The flute, like the weapon that sits on the other side of the belt, is made of a shiny, smooth, chrome material, that according to science will never rust or decay. Looking at it you are surprised at the mixture of memories it brings back. Some of great battles of the past, both those of history and those you've found yourself in, as well as the stage of a theater where you were forced to preform for the troops due to your skill with the instrument.

"I was better cause the others didn't practice," you comment to yourself as you look into the water to find the whirlpools only growing bigger. It will be several minutes until the gun's chamber is full again, and so you decide on a song that should take the same amount of time. Putting the mouthpiece to your lips you find that the personal mouthpiece still fits you perfectly, despite how long it's been since you first got it made. Laughing at the image of you in the mirror when you first received the instrument sends a small wind through it, that causes the instrument to play a short, sharp note.

That noise brings you back to the moment, and causes your mind to focus on the flute as if it were an extension of your being, as it was long ago during a battle with a particularly nasty race of... Forcing the memories of war from your mind you can find only ne song in your mind to play on the instrument, though its origins might as well be one of war, and is certainly one of death. Taking a deep breath you begin to play the Balled of the Blue Winds, the Eulogy of the Ukatai.

As the song takes over you being once more your mind is taken by images of the Ukatai and their sweeping cities. The deserts of their planet that went on forever no matter where you stood, and everywhere the light of at least two moons lit up the sky. It was near a lake of silvery water that the Ukatai built their monolithic grand design, which was the testament to their glory, and power. A bending of the very forces of their world to their will. The building of that monument would take many of their lifetimes, but the Ukatai cared not, for they put every heart and soul into the project.

They... A snap of a twig brings you back to reality, and forces you to admit that you've been playing with your eyes closed because you became wrapped up in the melody. Cursing yourself silently for making a rookie mistake you open your left eye slightly expecting to find yourself surrounded by drooling carnivores, but instead find that you have an audience of mixed company, including your hostess and her landlords. All of them are looking at you expectantly, some even making motions for you to continue with tears in their eyes. Not one to disappoint, you close your eyes and begin playing again from the point where you stopped.

You had originally planned on playing only the first movement of the piece, which is a few minutes long, but with an audience to please you decide to go through all three, including the part that is known to most races as Combine's Harvest, the third movement that the Combine, the human ‘government', discovered was hidden within the Pipes of the Blue Winds, sealed long ago by the Ukatai when they finished the building, and at last passed into the sands of time.

The creation of the pipes having used the fresh water of the lake, killed the Ukatai, dooming them to a slow death by thirst, but according to their writings they were happy, for they had finally made the winds sing to them. Utter foolishness. They died to prove something to themselves, and thus negated the proof. Many, of course, believed that the Ukatai remained somehow within the pipes, which were far too massive to make the notes they did.

Humans, masters of cynicism, did many scans of the pipes, finding that in their structure existed many smaller paths through which the air passed, causing many notes which became a single symphony when the wind blew strongly enough. The scans also revealed many blocked tubes that the humans eventually opened up, allowing the pipes to play the third movement, and thus gain the gift of the Ukatai. Many saw that movement as the testament to the human races lake of imagination and dreams, as it denied the dreams and stories that many had built up about the pipes and their magical songs.

Finishing the third and final movement of the song you rise to your feet and place the flute back in its spot on the side of you belt before plucking the weapon out of the water where it is more than full now because of the extra time you let it sit under the current. Checking it for a moment you slap it back into its holster before turning to face your audience, many of whom are just sitting around, unable to move as they are afraid to break the serenity of the moment, which the Ballad of a long dead race has created in the clearing by the stream.

"Ba Wee Grana Weep Mini Bong," you say while bowing deeply to them, and then without warning you spin on your heels and walk away. Several shouts follow after you, some asking for an encore, others asking what you had played and if you could teach them to play it. Ignoring both you make you way back to the rope that is your way into Ms. Aura's home and climb it back up to the door and inside. You see parts of the crowd standing now at the foot of the rope, but you ignore them as you walk inside.

"That was incredible," says the familiar voice of your jailer as she flutters her way into the open door and you grunt in response. She doesn't seem to notice your response or lack there of to her question and instead walks over to the chair and looks you in the eyes

"What is that song called?" she asks you, and you feel a moment of choice. You could of course give her a taste of human cynicism and tell her the title is Eulogy of the Ukatai, but you could just as easily tell her that it is entitled Balled of the Blue Winds. The first is of course the human name for the song, while the second is the name the other races call it.
15522121112111.title: A sweet melody, inspired by sorrow

choices: driven to school with him by Mrs. Dewclaw."
155221211121112.content:
"Its title is the Balled of the Blue Winds, and was written by the movement of air through a large construct on another world. I learned it from an old friend who wanted me to geta little more culture than I was," you tell her, leaving out the minor details of the statement, but giving the bird woman just enough that she was satisfied.

"Beautiful. I had no idea humans could learn such stirring melodies. Forgive me for saying but the data we have on you kind suggests a kind of..." she pauses as she searches for the right word to describe what she's thinking.

"Cynicism that makes us very depressing to be around,"you finish for her, having heard it said about your race more than once in your travels. Obviously it was exactly what she was thinking, but Ms. Aura still tries to think of a more polite way of saying it before she gives up and nods.

"Don't worry about it. We are like that, but that doesn't mean we can't appreciate the finer points of life," you tell her, pulling out your flute and playing a trilling tune before smiling and putting it away.

Ms. Aura smiles in response and then walks over to one of the doors that lead out of the main area of the home. You are reminded again that you have no idea where the bathroom is in this house, or if it even does have one, but your thoughts on personal hygiene are blasted from your mind as the carrion eater opens what you have to assume is her pantry, and from the smell coming from inside it's a well stocked one at that.

"So what would you like for breakfast? I don't exactly know what the dietary requirements for a human are, but we can whip something up that should suffice," you hear her say, and want to answer but are afraid you might just vomit if you open your mouth. After forcing your body to adapt to the smell, mostly by holding your nose shut, you pull out the pistol at your belt just as she exits the room holding what to her is probably a balanced breakfast, though to you it looks like something that belongs in a garbage dump.

"No thank you, this is all I need for food," you tell her, motioning towards the pistol in your hand.

"Oh you're going to go hunting?" she asks.

"What? No. Here let me show you," you tell her, pulling the pistol closer to you and putting one hand on top and one on the butt. Pulling the butt of the pistol down while holding the top in place you remove what to her probably looks like a gun clip, but instead of bullets it has small brown squares that resemble dried dirt clods.

"These," you begin, pulling one of the squares out of the gun, "are called nutrient cubes. They are a by product of the weapon's recharge cycle, which converts mass to energy. Well some guy figured that since nutrients are used by the body to produce energy he could basically create an energy supplement that cut out the middle man, giving the body pure energy to use as it pleases, and viola."

Placing the cube on you tongue you suck on it twice, feeling as the small piece of energy heats up, returning to the original form and then is literally absorbed directly by your body. The feeling of strength you get is an immediate pick me up, kind of like what you think caffeine did back in the days when people drank it for a wake up call.

"Interesting. Can I try a piece?" asked a new voice, and looking down you find that Ms. Aura's son has reentered the house. Looking to his mother you get a nod that you take to mean he can have a piece and so pull of a cube and hand it to him. The young bird sniffs at the cube, and finding it has no smell puts it in his mouth. You watch in amusement as he sucks on it, and then is surprised to find that it vanishes. You can see in his eyes the energy has done it's work and he's probably stronger then than he's ever been in his short life. His expression also shows that he's found the downside of the cube as well. Namely the fact that it tastes like cardboard.

"Woah," is all the little bird says as it hobbles off. You smile after him, knowing that he'll crash in a few minutes, and yet still feel like he could climb a mountain. Done with that you look back towards your hostess who is gazing after her son with a concerned look, but then turns back to face you.

"That won't hurt him, will it?" she asks, like a true mother, and you could almost laugh at the image it calls to your mind, but you stifle that emotion and respond in a matter of fact way.

"No it can't hurt him. He'll feel like a million does for the rest of the day," you say, scratching you chin as you search your memory for those old sayings, because you think there was something wrong with that statement, and obviously there was because your hostess has a short laugh and then looks at you with an amused expression.

"That's close enough. Anyway we have to get ready for school. Since I normally fly in to work I've had to arrange transport for you with Rudy. You'll be...
155221211121112.title: Breakfast of Terminal Gamers, Nutrient Cubes

info.brief_description: A furry vore story based on a popular comic strip involving a wolf married to a rabbit.
info.description:
A furry vore story based on a popular comic strip involving a wolf(Kell) married to a rabbit(Kevin). They have 3 children. Rudy, a teenage wolf from Kells previous marraige. Lindesfarne, Kevin's adopted teenage hedgehog daughter. Coney, a carnivorous bunny girl. For actual vore comics please join my group.

http://groups.yahoo.com/group/giantessandvore/

For those of you who do not know about Yahoo Groups, its completely free. If you still don't want to join check out the K&K comic website. Its got almost every comic.
